snippet: Mr. Sanders, the Vermont senator and presidential candidate, wrote to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo that he was “troubled by New York State’s refusal so far to invest in a fair contract” at the university.
abstract: Vermont Sen Bernie Sanders calls on New York Gov Andrew Cuomo to raise salaries for some 25,000 professors and staff at City University of New York, who have been without contract since 2010 and have not received raise since that time; Sanders has focused on income inequality during his presidential campaign, and city university system caters mainly to minority and low-income students.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Sanders, the Vermont senator and presidential candidate, wrote to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo that he was “troubled by New York State’s refusal so far to invest in a fair contract” at the university.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Urges Cuomo to Raise CUNY Professors’ Pay
headline.print_headline: Sanders Urges Cuomo to Raise CUNY Pay
